body:
### Describe the bug

Hi there,

I'm installing cython package at 3.0.0 on Ubuntu 20.04 on docker image but it gives error. I'm using python 3.10,6. Please provide a solution since it has stopped our business. Thank you.

comment_data.body:
We're at least compatible with Python 3.10.12 (here's our entire test-suite running under that https://github.com/cython/cython/actions/runs/5846367610/job/15851483904). So if you believe this an incompatibility with Python 3.10.6  as your title suggests, maybe you should update to that?

What's more likely is that the specific package you're trying to use isn't compatible with Cython 3.0.0. There are some deliberate compatibility breaks (and some accidental regressions, which we're fixing) in Cython 3.0.0 so not everything is compatible. If this is the case I suggest you pin Cython to the most recent 0.29 release for now.

This isn't a useful bug report though - it essentially says "some mystery package doesn't work with Cython 3". So even if we did think it's a bug, there is no indication about what we'd have to do to reproduce it.

If this is a support question rather than a bug report then it should instead go to the [cython-users mailing list](https://groups.google.com/g/cython-users).

title: [BUG] Cython 3.0.0 is not compatible with Python 3.10.6
